name: Hampton Inn Charleston - Historic District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property claims to be an historic building but it has been renovated from industrial use out of recognition.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: It is directly opposite the visitor centre where all the shuttles and tours depart so is conveniently situated - about 20 mins walk from the market area.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location to College of Charleston

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and have the usual HI comfortable beds. Appeared to be adequate tables for breakfast, including some outside. Breakfast was the usual fare - reconstituted eggs etc but also 'real' hardboiled eggs and some fresh fruit. American guests appeared satisfied!
reviews.title: Can't go wrong when you stay at a Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Wifi was a bit erratic - maybe because we were at the far end of the building.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn-Historic District

reviews.text: The hotel was pretty well what is expected of this reliable brand,
reviews.title: Decent location, VERY humid room

reviews.text: This hotel was a great surprise. The room was huge, beds were very comfortable and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is clean and up to date. I recommend this hotel for your stay in Charleston.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, clean and spacious!

reviews.text: Charleston hotels get a bit pricey during the summer months and Hampton Inn is no exception; however, the location alone makes it worth it. It's a bit nicer than most Hampton Inns, the rooms are clean, and the complimentary breakfast is great (for a free hotel breakfast anyway).
reviews.title: Great location and breakfast !

reviews.text: This hotel is centrally located in historic charleston. Walking distance to everything. Hotel is very updated with nice lobby, courtyard, pool area and rooms. Rooms were very clean and renovated. Beds were great too. Can't go wrong with this hotel!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn was great. The people were great. The room was great.
reviews.title: Great place l

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I followed my husband when he went on a business trip. I had the days to my self to explore the city. I felt safe being by myself and everyone was very helpful. The room was clean, quiet, had everything we needed. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay!

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights. Had a corner room on 3 rd floor overlooking street. No noise. Room clean, no mildew in bath. Breakfast room is clean. Staff very friendly and helpful with directions. Parking is located in adjacent city owned garage $14/day. Visitor center and trolley stops literally across the street. This location is a couple of miles from waterfront and market st, so just far enough away if you do not like to walk. Trolley will take you right there though. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here three nights, enjoyed the spacious king bed room with microwave, fridge and wet bar. Room was spotlessly clean. Bathroom had good lighting. Bedding and towels were Hampton quality and clean. We were are second floor, very quite. Loved the location, free trolly was just across the street. It was an easy walk everywhere. Breakfast area was clean and well stocked. Will stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hampton Inn Charleston Historic District. We could not have been more pleased. The rooms were very nice, bed comfortable, staff friendly, and location excellent. We loved being across from the visitor's center and the free trolley that shuttled us all over the downtown area. City Market and the surrounding area is a short 15 minute walk if you feel like a stroll. There are several museums and restaurants on the same block if you want to stick close.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was better than most and served in a lovely lobby with plenty of seating and space. The pool area was beautiful, complete with a large courtyard we enjoyed in the cooler evenings.
reviews.title: So nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only suggestion I could make is that it would be wonderful to have a minifridge & microwave in the room. Otherwise, everything was perfect! I fell in love with Charleston and will always check this Hampton Inn first when we return.
reviews.title: Stay here

reviews.text: Great place to stay.They allowed us to check -in early. Rooms were very clean, bedding was great and all of the staff made us feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We live about two hours from Charleston, so we visit regularly. The hotel is alright. Positives-The staff are very friendly and helpful. The pool isn't big, but nice and relaxing even though you are downtown. Very close to the city highlights! Negatives-I think the price was way too much, especially for a Hampton Inn. I've stayed in other hotels in downtown Charleston that were nicer for the same price. The beds were not very comfortable and the maids should pay a little more attention to detail.
reviews.title: Not too shabby, but not amazing

reviews.text: I went to Charleston, SC on May 30-June 1. We stayed at this Hampton Inn and LOVED it. The room was very nice. The bedding was extra comfy. The view of the courtyard was simply beautiful. We really enjoyed the breakfast, especially since the courtyard was such a nice place to sit and eat. The location of this hotel was wonderful. It was very easy to get to. We used the trolley a few times to get around and it was just fine. The only downside to this hotel was the parking garage. The spaces were very small and at times it was hard to find a spot. I wish this hotel had it's own parking lot.
reviews.title: I love Hampton Inns!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed two nights at this Hampton Inn and it was the perfect place to stay in Charleston--great location but a couple of blocks from the busiest areas. We love the bedding at Hampton Inn--clean white duvets,comfy beds and pillows. Our 4th floor room was huge, even had a small frig. and microwave, and sparkling clean. If you can stay over a Sunday night you'll get a much better rate!
reviews.title: Best bedding and a wonderful night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE hotel is wel maintained, Nice pool, they seem to go THE extra step here...really nothing to Complain about. There is à trolley stop at THE outside of THE hotel and there is al THE three free lines going from here. THE personal is friendly and ok.....really ok stay....
reviews.title: Close to everything direction you want because of THE shuttles...

aka: Hampton Inn Charleston - Historic District Hotel Charleston
description: At Hampton Inn Charleston-Historic District, you’ll experience antebellum architecture and fabulous shops of the King Street historic district right outside our hotel. Our Charleston hotel is in downtown Charleston adjacent to the Charleston Museum, the nation's oldest museum. Wake up to Hampton’s free hot breakfast. Explore nearby 18th century plantations, churches, and the Charleston city market, walking distance from our hotel.
